info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 4:57AM EDT until March 25 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Madison County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Mitchell County in western North Carolina... North central Buncombe County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Yancey County in western North Carolina... * Until 545 AM EDT. * At 457 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Erwin to 4 miles north of Marshall to 17 miles northwest of Downtown Asheville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Burnsville, Mars Hill, Ramseytown, Faust, Wolf Ridge, Poplar, Green Mountain, Swiss, Marshall and Buladean. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
